title: Stata
text:
Stata forums: official Stata forums
Stata blog: official Stata blog
StackOverflow: Q & A for Stata
Stata/MP Performance Report: Stata/MP is the multicore version of Stata available on FLUX. Particularly of interest is the table starting on page 17 which lists commands and how parallelized they are.
Internet Guide to Stata: A good way to get started with Stata modeling basics and more.
Social Science Computing Cooperative: Various articles from basic to intermediate topics.



Stata Press



Comparing the three variance estimators: OLS, robust, and robust cluster
Marginal Effects- Rich Williams notes- 1
Marginal Effects- Rich Williams notes- 2
Marginal Effects- Rich Williams notes- 3
Interactions with logistic regression

title: Workshop Notes
text:
Workshop Notes
CSCAR offers a number of workshops. Here are the notes for some of them:
Introduction to Stata
Introduction to SPSS

title: SEM
text:
lavaan: popular SEM package in R (see the CSCAR workshop also)
mediation



Mplus website/forums
Process Some clients ask about using Process scripts in SPSS, but these models are more flexibly engaged in SEM programs like Mplus, R, or Stata. This lists all of the processing models and then some for Mplus, which would easily translate to lavaan.



SEM page




CSCAR workshop: web notes for the workshop content and beyond
Personality Project: William Revelle’s site for psychometrics


Sample Size Requirements for Structural Equation Models Wolf et al. (2013)
Power analysis and determination of sample size for covariance structure modeling MacCallum et al. (1996)
web tool http://www.quantpsy.org/



Standardized coefficients greater than 1




Principles and Practice of Structural Equation Modeling: classic guide
Latent Variable Modeling using R: A Step-By-Step Guide: learn SEM in R
Discovering Structural Equation Modeling Using Stata

title: Consulting for Statistics, Computing & Analytics Research
text:
This is the resources site for CSCAR. For our main page, please visit https://cscar.research.umich.edu/.
To send a support email, please email stats-consulting@umich.edu.
To schedule a consultation, please email deskpeople@umich.edu.

title: General Statistical Resources
text:
This is a list of sites etc. that have some resources statistics in general or for multiple statistical programs or programming languages. For specific programs, see the program-specific wiki page.


Cross-validated: question and answer site for people interested in statistics, machine learning, data analysis, data mining, and data visualization.



UCLA ARC
Princeton dss



Hierarchical Model Visualization
Mixed Model FAQ



Statistical Learning Glossary
‘Awesome list’ of freebies



Effect Size Conventions Some notes on choices of small vs large effect sizes for use in power calculations.
Beyond Significance Testing Rex Kline’s text on issues with significance testing, how to do power calculations, and calculate effect size in a variety of settings.



When is complete case analysis unbiased?
Flexible Imputation of Missing Data (Book) - terrific text covering all aspects of multiple imputation.



See the SEM section.



How Big of a Problem is Analytic Error in Secondary Analyses of Survey Data? West et al. (2016)



Oh no I got the wrong sign
Factor Analysis vs. Principal Component Analysis
Change scores vs. ANCOVA
Problems Caused by Categorizing Continuous Variables
How to Spot Visualization Lies
What are pseudo R-squareds? Describes how pseudo R-squareds come about, compares and contrasts the various versions, and describes their limitations.
How much lower should AIC be before I prefer that model?
